description: OmniDev MVP - A meta-MCP that exposes 2 tools to LLMs while providing unlimited power through capabilities

userStories.title: Provider Selection During Init
userStories.description: As a developer, I want to choose which AI provider I'm using during init so that the correct files are generated for my workflow.
acceptanceCriteria: `dev init` prompts user to select provider(s): Claude (default), Codex, or Both
Selection can be skipped with `--provider=claude|codex|both` flag

userStories.title: Provider-Specific File Generation
userStories.description: As a developer using Codex, I want an AGENTS.md file created so that Codex can read my project instructions.
acceptanceCriteria: For Codex: Create `AGENTS.md` (uppercase) at project root
If `.claude/claude.md` already exists, append OmniDev section at bottom
Both files include placeholder for user to add 2-sentence project description

userStories.title: Single .omni Folder with Internal Gitignore
userStories.description: As a developer, I want a single `.omni` folder with smart gitignore handling so I can choose whether to share config with my team.
acceptanceCriteria: All OmniDev files live in `.omni/` folder
`.omni/.gitignore` created with patterns for working files
Init outputs message explaining sharing options
Do NOT automatically modify project's root `.gitignore`

userStories.title: Project Description Placeholder
userStories.description: As a developer, I want a clear placeholder in my instruction file so I know where to add my project description.
acceptanceCriteria: Both AGENTS.md and claude.md include Project Description section with TODO placeholder
Placeholder is prominent and easy to find
Init command outputs message reminding user to fill in project description

userStories.title: Explicit Capability Enablement
userStories.description: As a developer, I want capabilities to be explicitly enabled so that nothing runs without my consent.
acceptanceCriteria: Fresh init creates `.omni/capabilities.toml` with no capabilities enabled
User must run `dev capability enable <name>` to activate a capability
`dev capability list` shows all available capabilities with enabled/disabled status
`dev capability enable tasks` enables the tasks capability
`dev capability disable tasks` disables a capability
Ralph is available but NOT enabled by default

userStories.title: Capability Gitignore Export
userStories.description: As a capability author, I want to export gitignore patterns so my working files are automatically ignored.
acceptanceCriteria: Capabilities can export `gitignore: string[]` from their `index.ts`
When capability is enabled, its patterns are added to `.omni/.gitignore`
When capability is disabled, its patterns are removed from `.omni/.gitignore`
Patterns are grouped under capability name comment
`dev agents sync` updates `.omni/.gitignore` with capability patterns
userStories.notes: PRD-011 - Key feature for Ralph working files

userStories.title: Profile Management
userStories.description: As a developer, I want to create and switch between profiles so I can have different capability configurations.
acceptanceCriteria: Each profile has `enable` and `disable` lists that modify base capabilities
`dev profile list` shows all available profiles with active indicator
`dev profile set <name>` switches to a profile
`dev profile create <name>` creates a new profile

userStories.title: Config File Structure
userStories.description: As a team lead, I want a clear config file structure so I understand what each file controls.
acceptanceCriteria: `.omni/config.toml` contains project name and default profile
All files have clear comments explaining their purpose

userStories.title: Migration from Old Structure
userStories.description: As an existing user, I want my old `omni/` folder migrated to the new `.omni/` structure.
acceptanceCriteria: On run, detect old `omni/` folder structure
Offer to migrate to new `.omni/` structure
Delete old `omni/` folder after successful migration
userStories.notes: PRD-011 - Can be done after core features

userStories.title: Directory Structure Documentation
userStories.description: As a developer, I want clear documentation about OmniDev's directory structure so I understand what files exist and why.
acceptanceCriteria: Each config file's purpose is documented

userStories.title: Usage Mode Documentation
userStories.description: As a team lead, I want to understand the two usage modes so I can choose the right approach for my team.
acceptanceCriteria: Pros/cons of each mode are listed
Init output reminds user of options
